edu.wmich.cs3310.MPeter.hw1

Class RecursiveSearch

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wmich.cs3310.MPeter.hw1.RecursiveSearch

  • public class RecursiveSearch
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains several methods that are used to search for values in the array using recursive implementations.
    Author:
    Matthew Peter

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RecursiveSearch() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int binarySearch(float[] nums, float searchVal, int first, int last)
      This method uses a recursive binary search format to see if a specified value exists in an array, repeatedly splitting the array into halves until the value is found.
      int quadSearch(float[] nums, float searchVal, int first, int last)
      This method uses a recursive quad search format to see if a specified value exists in an array, repeatedly splitting the array into fourths until the value is found.
      int rangeQuery(float[] nums, float searchVal1, float searchVal2, int first, int last)
      This method uses the rangeQueryFindBound method to find the locations in the array of the searchVal1 and searchVal2 arguments.
      private int rangeQueryFindBound(float[] nums, float searchVal, int first, int last, boolean findingLower)
      This method uses a binary search format to see if a specified value exists in an array, repeatedly splitting the array into halves until the value is found.
      int ternarySearch(float[] nums, float searchVal, int first, int last)
      This method uses a recursive ternary search format to see if a specified value exists in an array, repeatedly splitting the array into thirds until the value is found.

        public RecursiveSearch()

    • Method Detail

      • binarySearch

        public int binarySearch(float[] nums,
                        float searchVal,
                        int first,
                        int last)
        This method uses a recursive binary search format to see if a specified value exists in an array, repeatedly splitting the array into halves until the value is found. If the value doesn't exist in the array, the length of the array is returned instead.
        Parameters:
        nums - Array of floating point values
        searchVal - Value being searched for in array
        first - Position of first value in subset of values in array
        last - Position of last value in subset of values in array
        Returns:
        Position of searchVal in array if found; Size of array if not

      • ternarySearch

        public int ternarySearch(float[] nums,
                         float searchVal,
                         int first,
                         int last)
        This method uses a recursive ternary search format to see if a specified value exists in an array, repeatedly splitting the array into thirds until the value is found. If the value doesn't exist in the array, the length of the array is returned instead.
        Parameters:
        nums - Array of floating point values
        searchVal - Value being searched for in array
        first - Position of first value in subset of values in array
        last - Position of last value in subset of values in array
        Returns:
        Position of searchVal in array if found; Size of array if not

      • quadSearch

        public int quadSearch(float[] nums,
                      float searchVal,
                      int first,
                      int last)
        This method uses a recursive quad search format to see if a specified value exists in an array, repeatedly splitting the array into fourths until the value is found. If the value doesn't exist in the array, the length of the array is returned instead.
        Parameters:
        nums - Array of floating point values
        searchVal - Value being searched for in array
        first - Position of first value in subset of values in array
        last - Position of last value in subset of values in array
        Returns:
        Position of searchVal in array if found; Size of array if not

      • rangeQuery

        public int rangeQuery(float[] nums,
                      float searchVal1,
                      float searchVal2,
                      int first,
                      int last)
        This method uses the rangeQueryFindBound method to find the locations in the array of the searchVal1 and searchVal2 arguments. It then returns the number of values that are within these bounds (inclusive).
        Parameters:
        nums - Array of floating point values
        searchVal1 - Lower bound value being searched for in array
        searchVal2 - Upper bound value being searched for in array
        first - Position of first value in subset of values in array
        last - Position of last value in subset of values in array
        Returns:
        Number of values within bounds of searchVal1 and searchVal2 (inclusive)

      • rangeQueryFindBound

        private int rangeQueryFindBound(float[] nums,
                                float searchVal,
                                int first,
                                int last,
                                boolean findingLower)
        This method uses a binary search format to see if a specified value exists in an array, repeatedly splitting the array into halves until the value is found. If the value exists, the position of that value is returned. Otherwise, the position of the closest value greater than (lower bound) or less than (upper bound) is returned instead.
        Parameters:
        nums - Array of floating point values
        searchVal - Value being searched for in array
        first - Position of first value in subset of values in array
        last - Position of last value in subset of values in array
        findingLower - Searching for lower bound if true; Upper bound if false
        Returns:
        Position of bounding value in array
